name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, johnnybaverage, ezcmac, twntysevn27, TheSheezie, Chetyre, zcross00, symbolsoup, riotdejaneiro, mikeronomicon, Thorfinn, Deusoma, kazad, Moraiat, bug, barfighting, regrepnsnefpoh, Koremora, NDCaesar, gtc, Sweetlips, FablesandBlues, atticusonline, LordPretzel, hotconnerybod, Carrot, mira, lk, fmercury, aHatOfPig, chatterjee, cognitonaut, regrepsnefpoh, nutmeg, GusPlease, RedJoker, eRiUukFJk, dropkickpikachu, DeathwishJones, sp1derbaby, Mastronaut, wehavemagnums, tragicone, Darthemed, kestral)

name: softerworld
text: Correction: wouldn't be as good if...

name: baryonyx
text: Why do you insist on making up terrible nicknames for everything .

name: bixschmix
text: It just makes me cringe.

name: heccibiggs
text: How come you are so GOD DAMNED stupid and just do the stupidest thing possible every SINGLE SECOND OF THE GOD DAMNED DAY!

name: poodlelucy
text: A comment left by poodlelucy was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by aseidel, AJESTERONLY, hooraybacon)

name: yaotzin
text:
Seems to me that the people who are the most vocal about disliking this asherdan guy are tsundere basically.

This is my third of fourth trip through the archives, first time with an actual account so I can see how terrible these posts are to garner such high lames.

All I see here, and through the rest of the archives however, is the collective passion of a nervous child, dipping little Ann's pigtails in the inkwell because they don't understand their feelings.

It's wrong and gross, and yet, something feels really right.

TL:DR Assetbar and Asherdan sitting in a tree, K-I-S-S-I-N-G...

name: dusty
text: it would be great if we could make that quote into one of those face book things where everyone says it to people and doesn't explain why.

name: spinynorman
text:
Hey! EVERYbody gotta have a nickname! In fact, I encourage a ridiculous stream of consciousness method of nicknaming, so my nicknames will evolve over time!

For example:

Jolene - Joe - Mean Joe Green - Giuseppe Verdi - Greeny - Collard Greens - Shit, I don't know? Something about collars? I haven't thought that far.

Yeah, I do that for everyone. If I like you, you have about twenty names for me, fitted to syntax and the beat of a sentence.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Homepie, zcross00, mikeronomicon, kenthegod, storableprawn, Koremora, hellsfruition, Sweetlips, kalensc, willt, LexSenthur, Epicurus, unsentletter)

name: mikeronomicon
text: A comment left by mikeronomicon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by love_is_so_punk, Norsef, cunty, goocifer, TonyHighwind, Kennisiou, Myre, Satyr, kestral)

name: farqussus
text: I just want to go back in time and make his Dad like him.

name: brinkmanship
text: Jesus Christ. Only one forum/commentboard in the world could take inter-user abuse to such a correctly-spelled, nay, ingenious zenith.

name: farqussus
text: an ingenious zenith. awesome.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: We can arrange that, if you'll agree to be his Dad.

name: i_love_kate
text: ...Green_tail?

name: deimosrising
text: Great soundtrack alt text.

name: spectre
text: Send Beef to the stars and 2001: A Space Odyssey flashes before his eyes. Well, bits of the soundtrack, anyway.

name: lizjones
text: Carl Sagan voice: "Billions and billions of stars"

name: ford
text: "Bill-yuns"

name: dusty
text: "I'm Leonard Nemoy, Join me as we take an expedition of cleaning your CD player or CD-ROM drive. Switch to track 4 to begin."

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, wittyname, josher, DerSquirrel)

name: dargibbles
text: So...he keeps an antique revolver in his thong, then? Ah, what a feeling it must be to conceal a deadly weapon amongst one's own junk!

name: qwerty
text: Also has the advantage of making your junk look bigger.

name: soticoto
text: Ray is packing heat.

name: prolefeed5
text: They don't call him Sure-Shootin' Rex Dandycorn for nothing...

name: puguglypress
text: They don't call him that for something, either. Because they don't call him that.

name: prolefeed5
text: http://achewood.com/index.php?date=08202007

name: fineoakstructure
text: Daaaaaamn.

name: stormagnet
text: Naw, man. Not necessarily, anyway. When challenging someone unarmed to duel, a classy gent will always furnish them with a weapon.

name: unsentletter
text: Well... hrrm... maybe he conceals his gun in the same place that Max (of Sam & Max ) hid his...

name: djwhiterabbit
text: i wonder why the stars (if they are in fact stars) in the final panel resemble a face.  is it a skull?  what's it supposed to represent..?  is it as simple as 'passing into death'?

name: epicurus
text: Good catch, I had never noticed the skull before.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Looks like Cartilage Head, if you ask me.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: i must admit that the cartilage head story arc has always left me utterly baffled.  not that i don't appreciate it - it just leaves me going 'whaaaaaa...?'  (^ ^,)

name: centipede_damascus
text: It just looks like a sad face to me. The opposite of the happy face.

name: rowboat
text: There has never been a happier face than that of a skull. It's the only emotion they know.

name: deusoma
text: They're like dolphins that way.

name: spinynorman
text: That is definitely a skull. Check out the hole where the nose goes.

name: rowboat
text: Good eye, indeed! Never, ever saw that. God, this is great.

name: spenham
text: It definitely looks like Lyle's Misfits shirt.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh my God I didn't notice that. I just thought it was a pretty densening (I Googled it and it is a word) of the stars. Now it's something to freak me out.

name: puguglypress
text: It looks like the_boffin from the Cornelius's computer arc.

name: pearced
text: It looks like your bottom.

name: tinhand
text: Presumably the skull represents death, basically because Roast Beef has died. His spirit does not look too bothered by the idea of floating in space though.

name: riazm
text: Ray and Beef are close friends such that Ray will genuinely kill you if you hurt Beef. Classic.

name: rowboat
text: Ray didn't kill himself after he shot Beef himself.

name: overmedicated
text: He wasn't dead, he was on life support.

name: rowboat
text: You're correcting a mistake that no one made. But thank you, though.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Man, I'm gonna use that putdown some day.

name: relaxing
text: The start of one of the most beautiful Achewood story arcs.

name: flavius
text: It's strips like this that make me wish there was something higher than a 5.

name: peterjoel
text: Strips like this really waste my time - I have to go back to all the 5's that I've given, and re-evaluate if they are still a 5 in light of the new evidence.

name: jonmw
text: ACHEWOOD: It throws off the goddamned scoring curve

name: carrot
text: Holy Jesus, the perfect sound track to this strip is Mr. Ambulance Driver by the Flaming Lips. Seriously, you will cry.

name: moraiat
text: Testing upon this hypothesis does not yield great results.

name: daidai
text: Aye.

name: aplomb
text: If you own House of Leaves , check out page 477. Navidson is dying and floating through the void, and he sings the same lines of Daisy Bell.

name: mikekitchell
text: House of Leaves , if one ignores the obnoxious side-story courtesy on one Johnny Truant, is a great book.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: And the obsessively composed inanely lengthy lists of names that sometimes run backwards in blue text.

name: banzairabbit
text: I love trying to describe this book to people who should read it.

name: mattylite
text: I am pro-House of Leaves, but also please note: HAL sings "Daisy" when Dave turns him off in 2001, all slow and creepy-style.  This in turn was a nod to Max Matthews, a computer music pioneer sort of guy, who got some computer to sing "Daisy" back when computers were gigantic, couldn't do shit, and had to be operated by the most ridiculously-bespectacled nerds in lab coats.

name: banzairabbit
text: *nods*  You know your stuff, sir.  Chubby.

name: stubob
text: Boffins?

name: lawdog
text: Edification, good sir!  I thank you.

name: chachibenji
text: Book inside a book inside a book inside a brainfuck.

name: notcool
text: Wait...somebody else made the mistake of reading Dhalgrin?

name: twohundredninety
text:
This is such a great strip. I just wish... I dunno, the format kind of prevents it, but the (excellent) composition and pacing would be even better if the panels of Beef floating into the afterlife were larger and more ... spacious-feeling, somehow. More space but also more stars.

It would make more visceral the feeling the strip already implies.

name: sidxdeadgod
text: Intense.

name: cousinted
text:
On top of the sky
Is a place where you go
If you've done, nothing wrong

name: f1shst1ck
text: This is a very poignant strip in Roast Beef and Ray's relationship. Ray would shoot his own uncle to avenge his dearest friend.

name: i_love_kate
text: I've no desire to detract from your heart-warming feeling of camaraderie, here, but as they were dueling and given Ray's pose in the second panel, does it not strike you as likely that he was about to shoot anyway?

name: choosebro
text: I think of Ray as a man who would only fire upon the uncle in self defence. Seeming that the uncle had already fired his shot, it's likely that this was purely a move of vengeance from ray.

name: sp1derbaby
text: "What an ass the man was to get in front of the guns!"

name: tbtabby
text: The juxtaposition of scenes! It's just like The Godfather!

name: c_dizzle
text: I do love the contrast in every other frame.

name: jonnay
text: That bullet was meant for Ray!

name: professorhazard
text:
Oh yeah like you gonna shoot your uncle Ray

Like you really gonna go all pro ice all of a s- oh

name: heyman
text: Ray can too go pro ice on someone if he's in a raw situation

name: edwell
text: Avenged within a second of hitting the ground.

name: ctaronno
text: Truly epic

name: gmm
text: Raw. Five.

name: comradepants
text: It's good to know that the shootout is taking place in the ER. You know, so if anyone gets hurt, they don't have to travel that far.

name: jonmw
text: But why did Ray move Tic-tac from his right hand to his left?

name: jonmw
text: I STILL DO NOT HAVE AN ANSWER

name: fineoakstructure
text:
He didn't, he's just stabilizing the gun with both hands in the 6th panel to make sure he shoots his own uncle straight through the heart.

(if you look closely, you'll notice another line and bit of white area above the left arm, and in between the gun and Ray's mouth)

name: lawdog
text: Did anyone else notice the face in the stars?  Or do I just need to finally wash my coffee mug?

name: tonyhighwind
text: I find Ray's dueling form to be exemplary.  A quick, clean, relatively painless kill without the indignity of having one's well-cultured features reduced to so much lean ground beef by merciless ballistics.  The downside is that in making himself a smaller target, he opened his best friend up to the shot meant for him; as we can all see, though, he rectifies the mistake with surprising alacrity.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
On further consideration, the switch from rapiers to revolvers was probably made precisely because this kind of kill became possible with firearms. Melee weapons are always a messy business, no matter how refined the hand on the hilt is.

If anyone is wondering, I am a bit into my cups, yes.

name: carlyle
text: I love this strip.

name: isarunasi
text:
I was listening to Michael Nyman, Lost and Found (The Piano)
It is just unreal combining this strip and music. The stars....

name: fourninefoxtrot
text:
Mainly, I'm just impressed with Ray's marksmanship. Truly, The Dude Has Got No Mercy . Upon seeing Beef laid low, he turns and fires a single shot, dead through the heart.

Fucking Beautiful.

A man should have at least one friend who will cold shoot a man to avenge him.

name: spaghetto
text: This is excellent. The last panel reminds me of Jamie Hewlett's style, for some reason.

name: griffypoo
text: With all his cyborg parts, he should logically be harder to kill...  Rational guy like him, you'd think he'd request a few redundant vitals he could fail over to in situations like this.
